title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Bakersfield

content.rendered:
Bakersfield, located in the southern end of California’s Central Valley, is a city in Kern County with a long history of oil and agriculture. The city is also known for its rich history, stunning scenery, and musical heritage, so you’ll find lots to do when exploring this amazing city. That’s where Roomi comes in – we help you find rooms for rent in Bakersfield. We’ll be your guide covering the best bars to exploring top universities in Bakersfield! Let’s dive into the basics: average rent, top neighborhoods and cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield.

Getting to know Bakersfield

Bakersfield is a town with a strong sense of belonging. The rent is among the most affordable in California, and you’re close to everything you want to explore. Bakersfield is also a gateway to the great outdoors, and nature lovers will find no shortage of things to do. The mountains are an hour away, the beach is two hours away, and LA is just two hours away as well. Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy this fun-filled city.

Finding rooms for rent in Bakersfield

Find A Room For Rent In Bakersfield

Bakersfield is less expensive than the rest of California. Yet, the cost of living in Bakersfield is higher – food, utilities, and transportation – than the typical American city. Let’s look into popular neighborhoods and areas with cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield, CA.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In San Jose

Top neighborhoods in Bakersfield

  • Seven Oaks: This neighborhood is another one of Bakersfield’s most livable areas. The low crime rates, excellent schools, and stable property market attract families to this area. The neighborhood’s median income is somewhat greater than the national average. This area is situated in such a way that it’s close to a wide range of facilities, so getting around should be easy.
  • Haggin Oaks: Well-known for its location, this is one of the best places to look for cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield. The rent goes as low as $500/month, making it an affordable neighborhood. Haggin Oaks neighborhood’s central position to Bakersfield’s different schools is one of the main reasons families head there.
  • Stockdale Estates: This is one of Bakersfield’s most popular communities. This area has pristine, fairly priced houses, excellent schools, and crime rates that are lower than the national average. There are several fascinating things to see and do in the area, with a variety of shopping and dining opportunities on offer.

Average rent in Bakersfield

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In South San Francisco

University life in Bakersfield

Most universities offer on-campus housing, where you can choose to live in dorms as well. But if you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield, we’ll help to ease the process of finding the best universities to pursue your studies.

Here are the top 5 universities in Bakersfield:

  • Bakersfield College
  • California State University, Bakersfield
  • Taft College
  • CAU – California Aeronautical University
  • Fresno Pacific University – Bakersfield Campus

How transit-friendly is Bakersfield?

Walkability

With a walk score of 83, most errands can be accomplished on foot. The most walkable Bakersfield neighborhoods are Oleander-Sunset, Downtown and Riviera-Westchester. If you’re planning on exploring cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield, walking will save you money and keep you active! Win-win!

Airport

Bakersfield is serviced by Meadows Field Airport (BFL), located 8 miles north of downtown Bakersfield and by Amtrak via the San Joaquin Route. For discounts on Amtrak travel to Bakersfield, click here.

Related: How To Make A Travel Budget & Stick To It?

Taxi

In urban America, a cab is an essential part of life. Taking a local taxi in Bakersfield, CA is a great way for residents and visitors alike to get around the streets. Additionally, taxi drivers will be familiar with the fastest routes and areas making it easier for you to find cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield.

Bus

Local city-wide bus transportation is provided by Golden Empire Transit. It serves the Bakersfield Urbanized Area as the major mode of public transit. Within a 110-mile radius, GET is the largest public transportation system. The Bakersfield city boundaries, as well as surrounding unincorporated regions, form the legal boundary of the District.

Cultural activities in Bakersfield

Bakersfield Museum of Art: Within the wonderful interior galleries and lovely garden setting, visitors of all ages will enjoy a broad variety of painting, sculpture, and other artwork. If you need a break after looking for rooms for rent in Bakersfield, head to the museum!

Bakersfield Symphony Orchestra: The Bakersfield Symphony Orchestra’s mission is to perform amazing concerts for all audiences. Additionally, the orchestra helps to teach the youngsters of Kern County more about classical music.

Downtown Arts District: Take a self-guided trip of arts spots. Make a stop at the locally owned Dagny’s, and don’t miss out on a concert at Jerry’s Pizza. This is where the hometown, Grammy-winning band Korn first played! Also, check out the Metro Galleries to see the best in locally produced artwork.

Related: 6 Signs You’re Ready To Move To A New City During The Coronavirus Pandemic

Nightlife in Bakersfield

1. Nuestro Mexico Lounge

Nuestro Mexico Lounge oozes historic elegance in a contemporary setting, with crystal chandeliers and exquisite paintings from Mexico City, as well as a well-stocked wood liquor cabinet. Moreover, this lounge is the place to go for the perfect drink mixes with flair and grace, with a rotating selection of specialty cocktails based on long-forgotten recipes.

2. Tiki-Ko

When it comes to going out for a couple drinks, Tiki-Ko is a game changer. This bar is authentically decorated with a tropical motif. Their ready-to-mix cocktails to-go are unquestionably among the best in town. Moreover, they offer a wonderful online menu with traditional tiki cocktails and several of their own excellent tiki beverages that you can order ahead of time.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Bakersfield? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
